posts.name: The Grey
posts.note: The Grey is a high-end retro venue with two bars offering modern Southern eats in a refurbished Greyhound bus depot. Occupying a 1938 art deco Greyhound Bus Terminal that was painstakingly restored to its original luster, The Grey offers food, wine and service experience that is simultaneously familiar and elevated.

posts.name: The Grey Market
posts.note: The Grey Market combines a Southern lunch counter and New York City-style bodega — bringing a 'come as you are, for anything you need' spirit to a genre made famous as a site of segregation. The Grey Market will serve Savannahians seafood boudin po’ boys, rare roast beef sandwiches, and a curry chicken salad (inspired by the Grey’s Chicken Country Captain) to-go.

posts.name: Narobia's Grits and Gravy
posts.note: Narobia's Grits and Gravy is a modest, down-home joint serving American comfort and soul foods for breakfast, brunch, and lunch. I saw Narobia's Grits and Gravy restaurant on Mashama Bailey's episode of Chef's Table on Netflix. Order the shrimp and grits with eggs over easy on top.
